data.title: Changed the Skin tinted drawable factory methods Skin#newDrawable to static
data.body:
I had a need for a tinted drawable without need for a skin instance, and realized the instance wasn't actually used in the method anyway. Maybe there's a reason to keep it an instance method, but as it is there didn't seem to be any problems. I know this will probably cause warnings on current projects that access the methods via instance.

I think there are more methods that could become static, looking at the class more now, like public Drawable newDrawable(Drawable). I could throw that in with this PR if you guys like the idea. Or if this whole idea sucks for reasons currently unknown to me, I'm cool with that too.

data.title: Protected Screen in Game
data.body: Sometimes it would be nice to be able to switch a screen without `Game` automatically calling `hide()` and `show()`. That's only possible by extending Game currently and overriding the method. However, this option is also not available, because the field is `private` and the extending class isn't able to set it.

data.title: Wiki needs updating
data.body:
It seems like the update to gradle changed some things that are not documented on the wiki. The biggest thing I saw was the Admob in libgdx page https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/wiki/Admob-in-libgdx

For example google updated adView so that instead of:

```
AdView adView = new AdView(this, AdSize.BANNER, "xxxxxxxx"); // Put in your secret key here
```

It has to be this:

```
adView = new AdView(this);
adView.setAdSize(AdSize.BANNER);
adView.setAdUnitId(AD_UNIT_ID);
```

Also for the control section to work you now need to add the android project to the core projects build path and then make circular dependancies just a warning in eclipse. There are various other problems with the page but I am to busy myself to go through and change them (maybe if no one else can I will next month). Even though they are trivial problems beginner coders may not understand how to get past them.

Thanks,
Mitchell

data.title: Added Pools.set(...)
data.body:
I've added a small method to `Pools` to be able to set a pool for a class directly instead of having a `ReflectionPool` created automatically. Sometimes a ReflectionPool just isn't possible, for example in case there is no default constructor.

I was also required to change the internal `Map<Class, ReflectionPool>` to a `Map<Class, Pool>` for that reason, which shouldn't be bad though.

data.title: Added a HttpRequestBuilder
data.body:
When working with Gdx.net to communicate with a JAX-RS webservice, I noticed that a small utility like this makes working with HttpRequests a lot more comfortable.

It's a pretty standard builder pattern with built-in pooling. Furthermore it offers some small additional features like a default timeout or a base-URL that can be set to avoid having to prepend the same IP/domain address for every request, when communicating with just a single server (which should be the most common case). Last, but not least, it offers two methods to form-encode and JSON-encode the request content as well as a method to implement HTTP basic authentication.
